critique: This document concerns the delegation of authority regarding federal salary administration. It amends a previous executive order to authorize the Civil Service Commission to prescribe rules and regulations related to section 504(d) of the Federal Salary Reform Act of 1962. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, or impact on national security vs. civil liberties. The document primarily deals with the internal workings of the federal government and delegation of power. It has a slight impact on federalism, as it centralizes authority within the Civil Service Commission, a federal entity. It also has a slight impact on economic regulation, as it deals with federal salary administration. There is no discernible impact on social inclusion.
